FuncDef:
The user-group command adds a user group to a user group load balancing group.
The undo user-group command deletes a user group from a user group load balancing group.
By default, no user groups exist in a user group load balancing group.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies a weight value.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 100. The default value is 1.

Specifies the name of a user group.
The value is a string of 1 to 32 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To distribute the traffic of users that go online through the same domain to different centralized CGN devices based on the user group weight, you need to configure a user group load balancing group, run the user-group command to add user groups (each with a weight) to the user group load balancing group, and run the access user-group-list (AAA domain view) command to bind the user group load balancing group to the domain.
Prerequisites
A user group load balancing group has been created and its view has been displayed using the access user-group-list (system view) command.
Precautions
A maximum of eight user groups can be added to a user group load balancing group.A user group that is bound to a NAT instance cannot be added to a user group load balancing group.A user group can be added to different user group load balancing groups.
